gurmukhi: pwrQ inkit bulwie kY khI kiRSn smJwie ] qum su suBdRw ko hro hau nih lirho Awie ]2435]
transliteration: Paarath Nikattee Bulaae Kai Kahikrishan Samjhaae|| Toum Su Soubhadra Ko Daro Hau Nah(i) Lariho Aae||2435||
translation: Calling Arjuna towards him, Krishna instructed him to abduct Subhadra and he would not wage a war with him.2435.

gurmukhi: qb Arjn soeI Pun kirE ] pUjn jwq suBdRw hirE ] jwdv sBY kop qb Bry ] sRI jdupiq pY Aie pukry ]2436]
transliteration: Tab Arjan Soiphoun Kario|| Poojan Jaat Soubhadraa Hario|| Jaadav Sabhai Kop Tab Bhare|| Srijadoupat(i) Pai Aae Poukre||2436||
translation: Then Arjuna did the same and he abducted the adorable Subhadra; then all the Yadavas getting infuriated came to Krishna imploring him for help.2436.

gurmukhi: sRI biRjrwj qbY iqn so kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq sunweI ] bIr bfy qumhUM ko khwvq jwie mMfo iqh sMg lrweI ]
transliteration: Sribrijraaj Tabai Tin So Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Sounaaee|| Beer Bade Toumhoon Ko Kahaavat Jaae Mando Tih San Laraaee||
translation: Then Krishna said to those people. “You people are known as great warriors; you may go and fight with him;

gurmukhi: pwrQ so rn mwNfn kwj cly qumrI miRq hI injkweI ] ikau n clo qum mY qb qY qijE Awhv sXwm iehY TihrweI ]2437]
transliteration: Paarath So Ran Maandan Kaaj Chale Toumrimrit Hinijkaaee|| Kio Na Chalo Toum Mai Tab Tai Tajio Aahav Syaam Ihai Thaihraaee||2437||
translation: “If you are going to fight with Arjuna, then this means that your death has come very near; I have relinquished fighting earlier, therefore you may go and fight.”2437.

gurmukhi: qb joDw jdupiq ky Dwey ] pwrQ kau ey bYn sunwey ] sun ry Arjn qo qy fir hY ] mhwN piqq qyro bD kir hY ]2438]
transliteration: Tab Jodhaa Jadoupat(i) Ke Dhaae|| Paarath Kau E Bain Sounaae|| Sur Re Arjan To Te Dar(i) Hai|| Mmahaan Patit Tero Badh Kar(i) Hai||2438||
translation: Then the warrior of Krishna went and they said to Arjuna, “O Arjuna! we do not fear you; you are a great sinner, we shall kill you.”2438.

gurmukhi: pMf puqR jwnI iehY mwrq jwdv mor ] jIA Awqr hoie sXwm kih clXo duAwrkw Er ]2439]
transliteration: Pand Poutra Jaaniihai Maarat Jaadav Mor|| Jeeo Aatar Hoe Syaam Kah(i) Chadyo Duaarkaa Or||2439||
translation: When Arjuna thought that the Yadavas would kill him, then he became agitated and started for Dwarka.2439.

gurmukhi: sUk gXo muK pwrQ ko murlIDir jIq jbY giH AwXo ] sRI biRjnwQ smoD kIE Ary pwrQ ikau icq mY frpwXo ]
transliteration: Sook Gado Moukh Paarath Ko Murleedhar(i) Jeet Jabai Grah(i) Aayo|| Sribrijnaath Samodh Keeodare Paarath Kio Chit Mai Darpaayo||
translation: On being conquered by the people of Krishna, when Arjuna reached Dwarka, then Krishna counseled him, “O Arjuna ! why are you afraid so much in your mind?”

gurmukhi: bXwh suBdRw ko kIn qbY jb hI muslIDir kau smJwXo ] dwj dXo ijh pwr n peIXq lY iqh Arjn Dwm isDwXo ]2440]
transliteration: Byaah Soubhadraa Ko Keen Dabai Jab Himousleedhar(i) Kai Samjhaayo|| Daaj Dayo Jih Paar Na Paeeyat Lai Tih Arjan Dhaam Sidhaayo||2440||
translation: Then he explained to Balram and got the marriage of Subhadra solemnised with Arjuna, a great dowry was given to Arjuna, who on its receipt started for his home.2440.
